summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center. U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman states the investigation into the sex trafficking charges remains ongoing and urges victims to come forward.

events.title: Ongoing Sex Trafficking Investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office states its investigation into the sex trafficking of minors, for which Epstein was charged, remains ongoing despite his death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center on the morning of August 9, 2019.
Epstein was facing federal charges brought by the SDNY for engaging in the sex trafficking of minors, which included a conspiracy count.
U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman acknowledged Epstein's death could present a hurdle to providing his alleged victims their day in court.
The U.S. Attorney's Office stated its investigation into the conduct charged in the indictment remains ongoing.
The press release includes a call for other potential victims or individuals with information to contact the FBI.
